Authorizations
1. President and directors authorized to investigate and propose a new dues
• schedule which would enable the organization to double its income during
the, next fiscal year,
2, Authorized president'to appointDallas Smythe, former FCC director of
studies, now fellow at Illinois U. Institute for Communications Research to
' conduct a r'udy ‘as basis for a plan to establish either an FM or a trans¬
cription 'network using a combination of present educational AM and FM
stations on a national basis. Study planned for completion and presents-,
tion to members January 1, 1948 (or as soon thereafter as possible) as basis
for plan to finance early costs of such an operation.
-3, Authorized the appointment of Marcus Cohn of Cohn & Marks, ' ashington
attorneys, as attorney for the National Association of Educational
Broadcasters without cost or obligation to theAssociation. (It was under¬
stood: the Association would pay out of pocket expenses incurred by Mr. Cohn
such as telephone, telegraph., etc,)
4, Authorized enlargement of expenditures for the Association newsletter
5. Authorized the Board of Directors to propose and state the policy of.the
Association' regarding television. This action was.to take into consider¬
ation the . provable' ponding reallocation of television facilities by bhe
FCC and if subh reallocation of television channels is to be made and
additional television channels to become available in other bands of the
soectrum, that sufficient' channel be set aside for possible educational
use. •The authorization also required the Board of Directors to.make clear
to the FCC that educational institutions by virtue of their administrative
organization and direct responsibility to a tax-paying public must of
necessity move slowly in such matters,-and that failure to act with speed
is not necessarily indication of lack of Interest or inability to proceed.
